alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 7:35AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in New Mexico... LOS PINOS RIVER AT Ortiz affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.6 feet, River will be at bankfull stage. Some low water crossings may become difficult to cross. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 5.6 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 900 PM MDT.
